title: Acts Chapter 19 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Acts chapter 19 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Acts Chapter 19 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Acts Chapter 19.

questions.question: Where did Paul find certain disciples while Apollos was at Corinth?
questions.correctAnswer: Ephesus
questions.explanation: Paul came to Ephesus and found certain disciples there as stated in Acts 19:1.

questions.question: What question did Paul ask the disciples in Ephesus regarding the Holy Ghost?
options: Have ye received the Holy Ghost since ye believed?
Do ye believe in Jesus Christ?
Have ye been baptized in water?
questions.correctAnswer: Have ye received the Holy Ghost since ye believed?
questions.explanation: Paul asked if they had received the Holy Ghost since they believed, as noted in Acts 19:2.

questions.question: What baptism had the disciples in Ephesus received before Paul's teaching?
questions.correctAnswer: John's baptism
questions.explanation: They answered that they had been baptized unto John's baptism according to Acts 19:3.

questions.question: What did Paul say John's baptism was for?
questions.correctAnswer: Baptism of repentance
questions.explanation: Paul said John baptized with the baptism of repentance, telling people to believe in Christ Jesus, as in Acts 19:4.

questions.question: What happened when Paul laid his hands on the disciples after they were baptized in Jesus' name?
options: The Holy Ghost came on them; they spake with tongues and prophesied
questions.correctAnswer: The Holy Ghost came on them; they spake with tongues and prophesied
questions.explanation: Paul laid hands on them and the Holy Ghost came upon them, causing them to speak in tongues and prophesy as stated in Acts 19:6.

questions.question: For how long did Paul speak boldly in the synagogue at Ephesus?
questions.correctAnswer: Three months
questions.explanation: Paul spoke boldly for the space of three months in the synagogue, as recorded in Acts 19:8.

questions.question: Where did Paul continue disputing daily after leaving the synagogue?
questions.correctAnswer: The school of Tyrannus
questions.explanation: Paul separated the disciples and disputed daily in the school of Tyrannus, per Acts 19:9.

questions.question: How long did Paul's teaching continue so that all in Asia heard the word of the Lord Jesus?
questions.correctAnswer: Two years
questions.explanation: Paul's teaching in Asia continued for two years, so that all Jews and Greeks heard the word, as stated in Acts 19:10.

questions.question: What unusual method was used to heal the sick through Paul?
options: Handkerchiefs or aprons taken from his body
Laying on of hands by others
questions.correctAnswer: Handkerchiefs or aprons taken from his body
questions.explanation: Handkerchiefs or aprons that had touched Paul were brought to the sick, and the diseases left them, according to Acts 19:12.

questions.question: Who were the seven sons of Sceva trying to do?
options: Call on the name of the Lord Jesus to cast out evil spirits
questions.correctAnswer: Call on the name of the Lord Jesus to cast out evil spirits
questions.explanation: The seven sons of Sceva attempted to call on Jesus' name to cast out spirits, as mentioned in Acts 19:14.

questions.question: What was the reaction when the evil spirit answered the seven sons of Sceva?
options: Jesus I know, and Paul I know; but who are ye?
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus I know, and Paul I know; but who are ye?
questions.explanation: The evil spirit acknowledged Jesus and Paul but asked who the sons of Sceva were, as in Acts 19:15.

questions.question: What did the man with the evil spirit do to the seven sons of Sceva?
options: Overcame them and they fled naked and wounded
Fled at the mention of Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: Overcame them and they fled naked and wounded
questions.explanation: The evil spirit leaped on them and overcame them so that they fled naked and wounded as stated in Acts 19:16.

questions.question: True or False: Many believers who practiced curious arts burned their books after believing.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Acts 19:19 states that many who practiced curious arts brought their books and burned them after believing.

questions.question: True or False: Demetrius was a silversmith who made shrines for the goddess Diana.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Demetrius was a silversmith who made silver shrines for Diana, as described in Acts 19:24.

questions.question: True or False: The townclerk encouraged the people of Ephesus to take violent action against Paul and his companions.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: The townclerk urged the people to be quiet and not act rashly, as recorded in Acts 19:36-41.

medium.title: Acts Chapter 19 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Acts Chapter 19 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is unsure if they have received the Holy Spirit. Based on Acts 19, what biblical truth would you share about receiving the Holy Spirit?
options: Receiving the Holy Spirit is evidenced by speaking in tongues and prophesying.
The Holy Spirit is only received through water baptism.
One must first travel to Jerusalem to receive the Holy Spirit.
The Holy Spirit comes automatically when you believe.
questions.correctAnswer: Receiving the Holy Spirit is evidenced by speaking in tongues and prophesying.
questions.explanation: Acts 19:6 explains that when Paul laid hands on the believers, the Holy Spirit came upon them, and they spoke with tongues and prophesied. This shows the manifestation of the Spirit's presence.

questions.question: How does Acts 19 teach us about the importance of understanding the gospel before baptism?
options: Believers should know about Jesus Christ before being baptized.
Baptism is only a ritual with no need for understanding.
Baptism should be done by any religious leader regardless of knowledge.
questions.correctAnswer: Believers should know about Jesus Christ before being baptized.
questions.explanation: In Acts 19:2-5, Paul asked the disciples if they had received the Holy Spirit and what baptism they had received, explaining that John's baptism was of repentance pointing to Christ. They were then baptized in the name of Jesus after understanding this.

questions.question: A believer is discouraged because their preaching is met with opposition. What principle of perseverance through trials can you share from Acts 19?
options: Paul continued teaching boldly for months and even moved to a different place for daily discussions.
Paul gave up when opposition arose.
Paul stopped preaching to avoid conflict.
Paul only preached to those who agreed with him.
questions.correctAnswer: Paul continued teaching boldly for months and even moved to a different place for daily discussions.
questions.explanation: Acts 19:8-10 shows Paul boldly speaking in the synagogue for three months and then moving to the school of Tyrannus to continue daily disputing, demonstrating perseverance despite opposition.

questions.question: What does Acts 19 teach about the impact of genuine faith on sinful habits?
options: Many believers confessed and publicly burned their books of magic.
Believers kept all their old practices.
Faith has no effect on personal behavior.
Believers hid their past actions and did not confess.
questions.correctAnswer: Many believers confessed and publicly burned their books of magic.
questions.explanation: Acts 19:18-19 describes many who believed confessing their deeds and burning costly magic books, showing repentance and separation from sin.

questions.question: How does Acts 19 illustrate the importance of church fellowship and serving others during times of conflict?
options: Paul’s disciples prevented him from entering the theatre to protect him.
Paul faced conflict alone without support.
questions.correctAnswer: Paul’s disciples prevented him from entering the theatre to protect him.
questions.explanation: Acts 19:30 shows the disciples stopping Paul from entering the theatre during the uproar, indicating their care and protective fellowship.

questions.question: Based on Acts 19, what virtue is demonstrated by the believers who publicly confessed and destroyed their magical books?
questions.correctAnswer: Humility and honesty in repentance.
questions.explanation: Acts 19:18-19 highlights believers confessing and burning their magic books, showing humility and integrity in turning from sin.

questions.question: How does the reaction of the craftsmen in Acts 19 teach us about balancing work and faith?
options: They were concerned about their livelihood but reacted with anger and disruption.
They immediately repented and supported Paul.
They used peaceful dialogue to resolve concerns.
questions.correctAnswer: They were concerned about their livelihood but reacted with anger and disruption.
questions.explanation: Acts 19:24-29 shows Demetrius and craftsmen worried about losing income from idol shrines, leading to a riot, demonstrating the challenge of balancing work interests and faith.

questions.question: True or False: According to Acts 19, miracles performed through Paul’s hands helped establish the early church’s credibility.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Acts 19:11-12 describe God working special miracles through Paul, helping heal the sick and casting out evil spirits, confirming God’s power and supporting the church’s growth.

questions.question: True or False: In Acts 19, when the seven sons of Sceva tried to cast out evil spirits using Jesus’ name, the spirits obeyed them immediately.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Acts 19:15-16 shows the evil spirit recognized Jesus and Paul but questioned the authority of the seven sons of Sceva, and then overpowered them, proving the need for true faith and authority.

questions.question: A new believer asks how they can grow strong in faith amidst opposition. Based on Acts 19, what practical advice would you give?
options: Continue daily learning and fellowship as Paul did in the school of Tyrannus.
Avoid all conflict by staying silent.
Stop attending church when opposition arises.
Only preach to those who agree with you.
questions.correctAnswer: Continue daily learning and fellowship as Paul did in the school of Tyrannus.
questions.explanation: Acts 19:9-10 shows Paul teaching daily in a school after opposition in the synagogue, emphasizing ongoing spiritual growth and fellowship.

questions.question: How does Acts 19 teach the importance of humility and contentment in Christian life?
options: Believers humbly confessed sins and destroyed costly magical items to please God.
Believers boasted about their past powers.
Believers insisted on keeping their possessions at all costs.
Believers ignored the call to repentance.
questions.correctAnswer: Believers humbly confessed sins and destroyed costly magical items to please God.
questions.explanation: Acts 19:18-19 shows believers humbling themselves to confess and burn valuable books, demonstrating contentment through obedience rather than possession.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Paul sent two men, __________ and Erastus, into Macedonia while he stayed in Asia for a season.
questions.correctAnswer: Timotheus
questions.explanation: Acts 19:22 states that Paul sent Timotheus and Erastus into Macedonia, showing delegation and trust in coworkers in ministry.

questions.question: What lesson about work ethic can be drawn from the disturbance caused by Demetrius and other craftsmen in Acts 19?
options: Protecting one's livelihood is important but must be balanced with respect for the gospel.
Economic concerns should always outweigh spiritual matters.
One should avoid all changes in their profession.
Faith should be compromised to keep business safe.
questions.correctAnswer: Protecting one's livelihood is important but must be balanced with respect for the gospel.
questions.explanation: Acts 19:24-27 shows Demetrius worried about losing income, but the conflict warns believers to balance work concerns with spiritual truths.

questions.question: How does the townclerk’s speech in Acts 19 guide believers in resolving public disputes within the church community?
options: Use lawful assemblies and legal means rather than riots or disorder.
Respond with immediate violence to opposition.
Ignore disputes and hope they go away.
Allow mobs to decide church matters.
questions.correctAnswer: Use lawful assemblies and legal means rather than riots or disorder.
questions.explanation: Acts 19:35-40 records the townclerk urging calm and legal resolution to disputes, teaching Christians to seek orderly and lawful processes.

questions.question: According to Acts 19, what role does prayer and laying on of hands play in spiritual growth and receiving the Holy Spirit?
options: Paul laid hands on disciples to impart the Holy Spirit and empower them for ministry.
Prayer is unnecessary for receiving the Spirit.
Laying on of hands is only symbolic and has no effect.
The Holy Spirit is received only through water baptism.
questions.correctAnswer: Paul laid hands on disciples to impart the Holy Spirit and empower them for ministry.
questions.explanation: Acts 19:6 describes Paul laying hands on believers, resulting in the Holy Spirit coming upon them, indicating the importance of prayer and physical impartation.

hard.title: Acts Chapter 19 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Acts Chapter 19.

questions.question: In Acts 19, what significant event occurs when Paul lays his hands on the disciples in Ephesus?
options: They spoke with tongues and prophesied
They were baptized with John's baptism
They began to build a synagogue
questions.correctAnswer: They spoke with tongues and prophesied
questions.explanation: Acts 19:6 records that when Paul laid his hands upon them, the Holy Ghost came on them, and they spake with tongues, and prophesied.

questions.question: Who were the seven sons mentioned in Acts 19 that attempted to exorcise evil spirits using the name of Jesus?
questions.correctAnswer: Sons of Sceva
questions.explanation: Acts 19:14 identifies these men as the seven sons of Sceva, a Jew and chief of the priests, who tried to invoke Jesus’ name in exorcisms.

questions.question: What was the reaction of the evil spirit to the seven sons of Sceva when they tried to exorcise in Jesus' name?
options: "Jesus I know, and Paul I know; but who are ye?"
questions.correctAnswer: "Jesus I know, and Paul I know; but who are ye?"
questions.explanation: Acts 19:15 quotes the evil spirit responding to them, recognizing Jesus and Paul but questioning who they were.

questions.question: What was the cultural and economic impact of Paul's preaching on the craftsmen in Ephesus?
options: Their trade was in danger due to decreased worship of Diana
Their wealth increased because of new converts
questions.correctAnswer: Their trade was in danger due to decreased worship of Diana
questions.explanation: Acts 19:26-27 explains that Demetrius and fellow craftsmen feared economic loss as Paul persuaded people away from idol worship, threatening their silver shrine-making trade.

questions.question: According to Acts 19, how long did Paul teach daily in the school of Tyrannus?
questions.correctAnswer: Two years
questions.explanation: Acts 19:10 states that Paul disputed daily in the school of Tyrannus for two years, spreading the word of the Lord Jesus.

questions.question: What did many believers do with their books of curious arts after confessing and showing their deeds in Ephesus?
options: They donated them to the synagogue
questions.correctAnswer: They burned them publicly
questions.explanation: Acts 19:19 records that many who practiced curious arts brought their books together and burned them before all men, showing a dramatic renunciation of their former practices.

questions.question: What special miracles were performed by Paul in Ephesus as described in Acts 19?
options: Handkerchiefs and aprons from his body healed the sick and cast out evil spirits
He raised the dead in the city square
He parted the waters of the sea
questions.correctAnswer: Handkerchiefs and aprons from his body healed the sick and cast out evil spirits
questions.explanation: Acts 19:11-12 describes God working special miracles through Paul, where handkerchiefs or aprons touched by him healed diseases and cast out evil spirits.

questions.question: What was the main topic Paul disputed and persuaded about in the synagogue of Ephesus for three months?
questions.correctAnswer: The kingdom of God
questions.explanation: Acts 19:8 specifies that Paul spoke boldly in the synagogue disputing and persuading concerning the kingdom of God for three months.

questions.question: How did the townclerk in Ephesus resolve the uproar caused by the silversmiths and the worshippers of Diana?
options: By urging the crowd to be quiet and settle matters legally
By calling the Roman soldiers to disperse the crowd
By ordering Paul to be arrested
questions.correctAnswer: By urging the crowd to be quiet and settle matters legally
questions.explanation: Acts 19:35-41 shows the townclerk calming the assembly, reminding them of their lawful options and warning against disorder without cause.

questions.question: What key theological point does Paul emphasize when explaining John's baptism to the disciples in Acts 19?
options: John baptized with repentance, preparing people to believe in Christ Jesus
John baptized with the Holy Ghost
questions.correctAnswer: John baptized with repentance, preparing people to believe in Christ Jesus
questions.explanation: Acts 19:4 clarifies that John’s baptism was one of repentance, directing people to believe on the one coming after him, namely Christ Jesus.

questions.question: What was the response of the Ephesian crowd when Alexander was brought forth to speak as a Jew during the uproar?
options: They shouted 'Great is Diana of the Ephesians' for about two hours
They listened attentively to his defense
questions.correctAnswer: They shouted 'Great is Diana of the Ephesians' for about two hours
questions.explanation: Acts 19:34 recounts that upon recognizing Alexander as a Jew, the crowd cried out together for two hours, affirming the greatness of Diana.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: After the uproar in Ephesus, Paul purposed in the spirit to go through _____ and Achaia before visiting Jerusalem.
questions.correctAnswer: Macedonia
questions.explanation: Acts 19:21 states that Paul planned, after these things, to pass through Macedonia and Achaia on his way to Jerusalem.

questions.question: True or False: The disciples in Ephesus had already received the Holy Ghost before Paul arrived.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Acts 19:2 records that the disciples said they had not so much as heard whether there was any Holy Ghost.

questions.question: What was the significance of the name of the Lord Jesus during the exorcisms attempted by the seven sons of Sceva?
options: It was recognized by evil spirits but required authority and faith to wield
It guaranteed automatic deliverance from evil
It was ineffective unless Paul was present
It was a secret name unknown to most
questions.correctAnswer: It was recognized by evil spirits but required authority and faith to wield
questions.explanation: Acts 19:15-16 shows the evil spirit acknowledged Jesus and Paul but questioned the sons of Sceva’s authority, demonstrating that mere invocation without faith did not have power.

questions.question: What literary device is evident in Paul's teaching from the synagogue to the school of Tyrannus in Acts 19, showing a shift from public to private instruction?
options: Parallelism between Jewish and Gentile audiences
questions.correctAnswer: Chiasm illustrating escalating opposition
questions.explanation: Acts 19:8-9 presents a chiasm where Paul first boldly teaches publicly in the synagogue, then after opposition, moves to private daily teaching in the school of Tyrannus, highlighting increasing resistance and adaptation.

theological.title: Acts Chapter 19 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Acts Chapter 19 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What did Paul find lacking in the disciples he met in Ephesus regarding their spiritual experience?
options: They had not received the Holy Ghost
They had not been baptized with water
They did not believe in Jesus Christ
They had not heard of John the Baptist
questions.correctAnswer: They had not received the Holy Ghost
questions.explanation: Acts 19:2 states that Paul asked the disciples if they had received the Holy Ghost since they believed, and they answered they had not so much as heard of the Holy Ghost. This highlights their incomplete understanding of salvation which includes the reception of the Spirit, consistent with Joel 2:28-29, John 20:22, Luke 11:13, and Romans 8:9.

questions.question: To what baptism were the Ephesian disciples initially baptized before Paul explained further?
options: Baptism in the name of Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: John's baptism
questions.explanation: Acts 19:3 says the disciples were baptized unto John's baptism, which was a baptism of repentance preparing for the coming Messiah. This is in line with the preparatory role of John as prophesied in Isaiah 40:3 and explained in Matthew 3:1-12 and Luke 3:3.

questions.question: What did Paul say John the Baptist’s baptism was a call to believe in?
options: The one who was to come after him, Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: The one who was to come after him, Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Acts 19:4 shows Paul explaining that John baptized with repentance, urging people to believe on Jesus Christ who was to come after him, emphasizing Christ as the fulfillment of the Messianic hope (Isaiah 9:6, Malachi 3:1, John 1:29, Acts 3:20-21).

questions.question: What was the immediate spiritual result when Paul laid hands on the disciples in Ephesus?
options: They received the Holy Ghost, spoke in tongues, and prophesied
They were healed of physical diseases
They received visions of the future
questions.correctAnswer: They received the Holy Ghost, spoke in tongues, and prophesied
questions.explanation: Acts 19:6 records that after Paul laid hands on them, the Holy Ghost came on them, and they spoke with tongues and prophesied. This Pentecostal outpouring confirms the New Covenant promise of the Spirit (Joel 2:28, Acts 2:4, 1 Corinthians 12:10, and Romans 8:16).

questions.question: How long did Paul preach boldly in the synagogue in Ephesus about the kingdom of God?
questions.correctAnswer: Three months
questions.explanation: Acts 19:8 states that Paul preached boldly in the synagogue for three months concerning the kingdom of God, demonstrating the importance of public proclamation of the gospel as seen also in Acts 13:44, Acts 17:2, Matthew 10:7, and Mark 1:14-15.

questions.question: Where did Paul continue to teach daily after some refused to believe and spoke evil of the Way?
options: In the synagogue of the Jews
questions.correctAnswer: In the school of Tyrannus
questions.explanation: Acts 19:9-10 describes Paul separating the disciples and teaching daily in the school of Tyrannus for two years, showing the early church’s method of thorough discipleship and teaching (2 Timothy 2:2, Acts 17:11, Colossians 1:28, and Matthew 28:19-20).

questions.question: What special miracles did God perform through Paul in Ephesus?
options: Healing diseases and casting out evil spirits through handkerchiefs and aprons
questions.correctAnswer: Healing diseases and casting out evil spirits through handkerchiefs and aprons
questions.explanation: Acts 19:11-12 explain that God performed miracles through Paul, such that handkerchiefs and aprons carried from his body healed the sick and cast out evil spirits, showing God’s power over sickness and demonic forces (Exodus 15:26, Isaiah 53:4-5, Mark 16:17-18, and James 5:14-15).

questions.question: What was the response of the evil spirits when seven sons of Sceva attempted to use Jesus’ name to exorcise them?
options: "Jesus I know, and Paul I know; but who are ye?"
"We flee at the name of Jesus"
questions.correctAnswer: "Jesus I know, and Paul I know; but who are ye?"
questions.explanation: Acts 19:15 records the evil spirit’s recognition of Jesus and Paul but rejection of the sons of Sceva, illustrating that true authority in spiritual warfare depends on genuine relationship with Christ (Luke 10:17, James 2:19, Matthew 7:21, and 1 John 4:4).

questions.question: What was the public reaction in Ephesus after the incident with the seven sons of Sceva?
options: Fear fell on all, and the name of the Lord Jesus was magnified
They expelled Paul from the city
questions.correctAnswer: Fear fell on all, and the name of the Lord Jesus was magnified
questions.explanation: Acts 19:17 describes how the incident caused fear among Jews and Greeks, leading to the magnification of Jesus’ name, emphasizing the power and reverence due to Christ (Psalm 34:7, Proverbs 1:7, Hebrews 12:28, and Philippians 2:9-11).

questions.question: What did many believers do with their books of curious arts after coming to faith in Ephesus?
options: They brought them together and burned them
They sold them to the highest bidder
They hid them in secret places
They used them to teach others
questions.correctAnswer: They brought them together and burned them
questions.explanation: Acts 19:19 shows believers confessing and burning their books of magic arts, demonstrating repentance and renunciation of occult practices (Isaiah 1:16, 2 Corinthians 6:14, Galatians 5:20, and Deuteronomy 18:10-12).

questions.question: What was the economic concern of Demetrius, the silversmith in Ephesus?
options: That Paul's preaching was turning people away from worshiping Diana, threatening their trade
That Paul was stealing silver from their workshops
That the government was taxing their goods heavily
That the synagogue was gaining too many followers
questions.correctAnswer: That Paul's preaching was turning people away from worshiping Diana, threatening their trade
questions.explanation: Acts 19:24-27 explains Demetrius' concern that Paul's message that 'gods made with hands are no gods' endangered their livelihood of making silver shrines for Diana, highlighting the socio-economic impact of the gospel (Exodus 20:3-5, Jeremiah 10:14-15, Psalm 115:4-8, and Isaiah 44:9-20).

questions.question: What slogan did the crowd in Ephesus cry out during the uproar caused by Paul's preaching?
questions.correctAnswer: "Great is Diana of the Ephesians"
questions.explanation: Acts 19:28 and 34 record the crowd shouting 'Great is Diana of the Ephesians,' reflecting their zeal for the pagan goddess and resistance to the gospel, consistent with the idolatry condemned in Exodus 20:3, Romans 1:23, 1 Corinthians 8:4-6, and Jeremiah 7:18.

questions.question: Who were Gaius and Aristarchus in the context of this chapter?
questions.correctAnswer: Paul’s companions from Macedonia
questions.explanation: Acts 19:29 identifies Gaius and Aristarchus as men of Macedonia and companions of Paul, caught up in the riot, illustrating the fellowship and support among early believers (Acts 20:4, 2 Timothy 4:11, Philippians 2:25, and Colossians 4:10).

questions.question: What advice did certain friends of Paul give him concerning the uproar in the theatre?
options: They urged him not to enter the theatre to avoid danger
They encouraged him to speak boldly to the crowd
They told him to flee the city immediately
They suggested he confront Demetrius publicly
questions.correctAnswer: They urged him not to enter the theatre to avoid danger
questions.explanation: Acts 19:31 describes that some chief men who were friends of Paul sent word to him to not venture into the theatre, showing prudence in the face of potential violence, consistent with Jesus’ teaching in Matthew 10:16, Romans 12:18, Proverbs 22:3, and Ecclesiastes 3:7.

questions.question: How did the town clerk resolve the confusion and uproar in Ephesus?
options: By calming the crowd and urging lawful procedures for complaints
By ordering the arrest of Paul and his companions
By calling for a sacrifice to Diana
questions.correctAnswer: By calming the crowd and urging lawful procedures for complaints
questions.explanation: Acts 19:35-41 shows the town clerk appealing to reason, reminding the crowd of the lawful process for disputes and warning of consequences if disorder continued, exemplifying civic responsibility and peacekeeping (Romans 13:1-7, 1 Peter 2:13-17, Proverbs 20:3, and Titus 3:1).
